SENT.plain: One month previously, a 28-year old male underwent an emergency modified Bentall procedure because of Marfan syndrome with acute aortic dissection Stanford Class A
Computed tomography of the chest did not reveal severe graft stenosis of the anastomosis
To explore the cause of anaemia, renal dysfunction and macroscopic haematuria, the patient was tested for antineutrophil cytoplasmic antibody (ANCA)-associated systemic vasculitis (AASV)
Antimyeloperoxidase antibodies (MPO)-ANCA and antiproteinase 3 antibodies (PR3)-ANCA were strongly positive
Corticosteroid therapy was applied, followed by cyclophosphamide and azathioprine
In response to treatment, the MPO-ANCA and PR3-ANCA levels gradually decreased, proteinuria was alleviated and haemoglobin levels returned to normal after 6 months
This is the first report to highlight haemolytic anaemia and AASV with Marfan syndrome after surgery for aortic dissection
